column4: any highlights on how to get this look back in oneiric? http://www.videolog.tv/video.php?id=670508 -- first the cube and floating windows, then maybe emerald decoration
the cube is not compatible with the Unity shell used by oneiric
from what I've read, what we'd call 'gnome 3' is actually 'gnome 3 shell', right? and unity is an alternative shell, right?
Nope. GNOME 3 is Gnome 3. Gnome Shell is a part of it. Unity is a shell alternative but Ubuntu uses Gnome 3 regardless.
it's possible to install Gnome Shell or Gnome fallback (with the oldschool panel).
ok so it's just that it's part of it
I tried the fallback package and the panels looked very weird, with clock in the middle, empty spaces and such
because it's meant to look like Gnome Shell. There's a way to modify the panel.
I think Alt + right click
a way to modify it to look exactly like in the video? alt+ right click? ok will take a look (in windows now)
not exactly like in the video.
because some applets are no longer available.
well I think that's not an issue
got to memorize, alt+right click....
wait, what's the difference between the fallback package and gnome shell?
huh.. GNOME Shell uses graphical acceleration and the fallback package resembles GNOME 2 and doesn't?
you mean ' GNOME Shell uses graphical acceleration and the fallback package resembles GNOME 2?' (no ' and doesn't')
Gnome fallback does not need graphical acceleration (but you might use compiz with it)
ok thanks... so what do you think is better for trying to get that old look back, (fallback + compiz) or gnome-shell?
you should try Gnome Shell first before trying to work on fallback.
ok thanks
